POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking qualified applicants for the position of Benefit Issuance Specialist. The Benefit Issuance Specialist is responsible for working with the Director, agency staff and external parties to ensure the delivery of benefits by Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT), direct deposit, and checks to DTA clients and to perform related, essential unit tasks in compliance with Department, State, Federal policy and procedures. The position is involved in the preparation of change order requests; contributing to the development of new policies; managing resources and contracts; and providing general Benefit Issuance Unit support as necessary. The duties will include but are not limited to:

Daily verification and reconciliation of file transmissions containing client benefit records to the bank and EBT vendor.
EBT adjustments utilizing the EBT administrative terminal to add benefits to client EBT accounts and process benefit repayments.
Research and issue replacement checks to clients.
Research and reissue daily direct deposit returns to clients.
Process orders, package and mail card issuance supplies (CIS) to statewide Transitional Assistance Offices (TAO). Log shipments and maintain records.
Retrieve, format and distribute weekly Case/Card warning reports.
Log, track and distribute data on undeliverable EBT cards.
Log, monitor and research EBT misdispense claims and client disputes. Prepare and mail related client notifications for closed claims and disputes.
Generate and provide benefit financial history statements for other DTA units and Boston Legal Services, upon request.
Deactivate EBT cards.
Provide back-up in conducting random weekly reviews of CIS logs maintained by TAOs to ensure compliance with procedures and accountability of card stock.
Assess and make recommendations for improvements in unit procedures.
Additional tasks or special projects will be assigned, as needed.
